author: sky.cactus
content: **TL;DR**: If you have 51% of hashing power, it is *far* (order of magnitude) more profitable to execute a censorship attack.  Also, in a censorship attack it is profitable to join the attack and non-profitable to act against the attacker.  While tip manipulation can add additional profit to censorship attacks, in tip manipulation attack alone it is non-profitable to join the attacker and profitable to act against the attacker.

author: sky.cactus
content: Thus, we tend to ignore tip manipulation attacks because they are "meh" compared to existing attacks.

content: If the base fee goes up to the point where transaction fees significantly outpace block rewards then it increases the profitability of censorship attacks.  There is *always* the problem (no matter how high the base fee is) though that it is more profitable to defect from the non-censorship base-fee manipulating coalition than to join it.

author: sky.cactus
content: So censorship attacks are the *real* problem here.
